com.github.luka5w.util.encryption

Class HashedPassword

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.luka5w.util.encryption.HashedPassword

  • public class HashedPassword
extends java.lang.Object
    HashedPassword

    A class store and interact with a hashed password

    GitHub: https://github.com/luka5w/encryption

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HashedPassword(byte[] hashedPassword, byte[] salt)
      Restores an existing salted hashed password from byte-array using UTF-8 as charset and SHA-256 as algorithm.
      HashedPassword(byte[] hashedPassword, byte[] salt, java.nio.charset.Charset charset, java.lang.String algorithm)
      Restores an existing salted hashed password from byte-array using a custom charset and hash-algorithm.
      HashedPassword(java.lang.String password)
      Creates a new salted and hashed password from String using UTF-8 as charset and SHA-256 as algorithm.
      HashedPassword(java.lang.String password, java.nio.charset.Charset charset, java.lang.String algorithm)
      Creates a new salted and hashed password from String using a custom charset and hash-algorithm.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HashedPassword

        public HashedPassword(java.lang.String password)
               throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Creates a new salted and hashed password from String using UTF-8 as charset and SHA-256 as algorithm.
        Parameters:
        password - The password to hash.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Shouldn't be thrown because the algorithm is hardcoded.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • HashedPassword

        public HashedPassword(java.lang.String password,
                      java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                      java.lang.String algorithm)
               throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Creates a new salted and hashed password from String using a custom charset and hash-algorithm.
        Parameters:
        password - The password to hash.
        charset - The charset to use.
        algorithm - The hash-algorithm to use.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - See hash(String).
        Since:
        1.0.0
